page.title: 11BOTTLE BANKS
page.content: In 1982 Lewes District Council installed{bottle banks}at several locations throughout the district. These{are metal containers}where the public puts used bottles{for {recycling.}There are two in this block at Malling, one for clear glass, one for coloured. The bottles are sold to manufacturers in London whose lorries collect it fortnightly. It is cleaned and made into cullet by crushing. This is either used for making roads or melted down to make new glass. {Many local people save their bottles. This has three advantages: it helps {avoid broken glass}in dustbins, makes a{small profit}which is{donated to {charity}and{saves energy and {resources.}Not all bottles are recycled in this way. Some, such as milk bottles, are returned for re-use.
